description: The freshman seminar will engage students in critical thinking of Chinatowns in history and myth. What are the stereotypes and perceptions of Chinatown among people in the West and the East? What are the facts and what are the misconceptions? How have Chinatowns evolved over time? What is the fate of Chinatowns in this changing world? Students will investigate the representation of the Chinese and the Chinatowns through historical accounts, novels, poetry, photographs, cartoons, films, and personal memory, etc. The seminar will focus on the Chinatowns in North America and Southeast Asia, and comparative analysis will be encouraged whenever possible.
title: FS: Chinatowns: History and Myth
